Commune"
In effect, Mao was quite clear about the great significance as well as the great
difficulties of making fundamental changes in revolution, i.e., making revolution
within revolution.In a talk addressed to chief leaders in the Central Committee in July
1966, Mao highlighted the importance of the CR which came at a critical juncture in
the building of socialism: “The current Great Cultural Revolution is an earthshaking
event. Can we or do we dare undergo the test of socialism? This aims in the final
analysis to wipe out classes and reduce the three great differences."57 In other words
in preventing the possible emergence of a new privileged class and gradually reducing
all the inequalities inheritedfrom the oldsociety,theCR represented a crucial
watershed in continuous revolution that would keep China on the socialist and
communistroad.
